Class: AMarker

AMarker(value)

This class represents a `a-marker` element for use in the AR.js context. The marker will always be of type "barcode". This is the heart of the scene and all other elements need to be connected to a marker, for them to be visible in the scene. For more information about barcode markers and possible values look at: Marker

Constructor

new AMarker(value)

Create an instance of the `AMarker` class.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
value string The barcode value of the marker.
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 376
See:
  • Element for the base class.
Example
const oh = new AMarker("0");
const hey = new AMarker("1");
const mark = new AMarker("5");

Methods

addTextBox(value, width, wrapCount, position, rotation)

This method creates a `TextBox` element and appends it to this marker. The `textColor` is set to "black". The `boxColor` is set to "white". The `boxOpacity`is set to "0.3".
Parameters:
Name Type Description
value string The text value of the `TextBox`.
width string | number The width of the text block.
wrapCount string | number Number of characters before wrapping text.
position string Position of the `TextBox` relative to the marker position.
rotation string Rotation around the center of the new `TextBox` element in dec.
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 476
Returns:
The added `TextBox` element.
Example
const marker = new AMarker("1");
marker.addTextBox(
 "Beware of the TextBox-Mimic!", 
 "10", 
 50, 
 "0 1 0.5", 
 "-90 0 10"
);

appendChild(child) → {Element}

This method appends a child element to this element. The child needs to be an instance of the `Element` class too.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
child Element The child element.
Overrides:
  • Element#appendChild
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 64
Throws:
Will throw an error, if the child is no instance of the `Element` class.
Type
TypeError
Returns:
Returns the appended child.
Type
Element
Example
const parent = new Element("a-scene");
const child = new Element("a-marker");
parent.appendChild(child);

clear() → {void}

This method clears all the child elements from this element and also removes them from the DOM.
Overrides:
  • Element#clear
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 97
Returns:
This method does not return anything.
Type
void
Example
const parent = new Element("a-scene");
const child = new Element("a-marker");
parent.clear();
// This removes child from the parent element and the DOM.

getAttribute(key) → (nullable) {string}

Getter method for the value of an attribute on the element.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
key string The name of the attribute.
Overrides:
  • Element#getAttribute
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 163
Returns:
The value of the attribute or `null`, if the attribute does not exist.
Type
string
Example
const universe = new Element("a-entity");
universe.setAttribute("answer", "42");
console.log(element.getAttribute("answer"));
// This will output "42".
console.log(element.getAttribute("question"));
// This will output "null"!

getVisibility() → {boolean}

Getter method for the visibility flag of this element, because the flag is not attached to the element directly.
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 425
Returns:
Returns the visibility flag.
Type
boolean

highlightMarker(color) → {void}

The method highlights this marker in the scene, by adding a colored box on top of the marker.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
color string The color of the box.
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 443
Returns:
This method does not return anything.
Type
void
Examples
const marker = new AMarker("1");
marker.highlightMarker("red");
const marker = new AMarker("1");
marker.highlightMarker("rgb(255, 0, 100)");

setAttribute(key, value) → {Element}

Setter method for a single attribute on the element.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
key string The name of the attribute.
value string The value to set.
Overrides:
  • Element#setAttribute
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 120
Returns:
Returns the the current element for method chaining.
Type
Element
Example
const sun = new Element("a-entity");
sun.setAttribute("pros", "life").setAttribute("cons", "deadly laser");
// This will set the two attributes "pros" and "cons".

setAttributes(attributes) → {Element}

Setter method for multiple attributes on the element at once.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
attributes Object.<string, string> Object, where each key is an attribute name, and the corresponding value is the value of the attribute.
Overrides:
  • Element#setAttributes
Source:
  • sceneObjects.js, line 141
Returns:
Returns the the current element for method chaining.
Type
Element
Example
const sun = new Element("a-entity");
sun.setAttributes({
 "pros": "life",
 "cons": "deadly laser"
});
// This will set two attributes "pros" and "cons".
